23-038CP.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission Regular Meeting of Thursday, August 10, 2023.A motion was made by Commissioner McNinch, seconded by Commissioner Garcia, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Page 1 of 5411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMTHURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 14, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESYes: 8 - Irma Archuleta, Desmond Fletcher, Veronica Garcia, David Ochoa, Dianne McNinch, Rocio Torres, Brent Walmsley and Michael SotoAbsent: 3 - Michele Anderson, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto and Merry TaheriPUBLIC COMMENT  (5:34 PM)No members of the public addressed the Commission.MANAGER'S REPORT  (5:34 PM)Patrick Weithers, Manager of the CPCC, spoke; and provided the Manger's report.Chair Soto spoke.REMARKS FROM THE CHAIR AND COMMISSIONERS  (5:39 PM)There were no remarks from the Chair or Commissioners.RECESS TO CLOSED SESSION  (5:39 PM)At 5:39 PM, there being no objection, Chair Soto recessed the meeting to Closed Session.RECONVENE FROM CLOSED SESSION  (7:30 PM)At 7:30 PM, Chair Soto reconvened the meeting.ROLL CALL  (7:30 PM)Irma Archuleta, Desmond Fletcher, Veronica Garcia, David Ochoa, Dianne McNinch, Rocio Torres, Brent Walmsley and Michael Soto   Commissioners Present:Michele Anderson, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto and Merry Taheri   Commissioners Absent:Page 2 of 5411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMTHURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 14, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTES2.

23-039CP.summary: Recommendation to receive Commission's vote and refer findings to the City Manager.Chair Soto reported out from Closed Session the following actions taken:[1] Case 22-149 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 -  Unbecoming Conduct, 2 - Use of Force, 3 - Use of Force, for Officer accused, 4 - Unbecoming Conduct, and 5 - Unbecoming Conduct for First, Second, and Third Officers accused;[2] Case No. 22-152 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 2 - Harassment, 3 - Failure to Take Action, 5 - Failure to Take Action for Officer accused, and 4 - Dishonesty for First and Second Officers accused;[3] Case No. 22-161 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 3 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused, and 2 - Unbecoming Conduct for the Long Beach Police Department;[4] Case No. 22-164 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Failure to Take Report for First and Second Officers accused and 2 - Failure to Take Report for Officer accused;[5] Case No. 22-163 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Sexual Misconduct and 2 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[6] Case No. 22-151 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[7] Case No. 22-160 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Dishonesty and for First and Second Officers accused;[8] Case No. 22-158 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[9] Case No. 22-150 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Failure to Take Action for First, Second, Third, and Fourth Officers accused;[10] Case No. 22-157 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Page 3 of 5411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMTHURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 14, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESFailure to  Investigate for Officer accused;[11] Case No. 22-155 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused; and[12] Case No. 22-153 Commissioners voted 8-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Misuse of Authority for Officer accused.A motion was made by Commissioner Ochoa, seconded by Commissioner McNinch, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 8 - Irma Archuleta, Desmond Fletcher, Veronica Garcia, David Ochoa, Dianne McNinch, Rocio Torres, Brent Walmsley and Michael SotoAbsent: 3 - Michele Anderson, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto and Merry Taheri3.
